115332212212.title: Scizor

11533221221221.content:
The forest air was cool as you stepped into the shade provided by the trees. You brushed your shaggy brown hair out of your green eyes letting them adjust to the lower level of light. You could hear the sounds of various Pokemon going about their business.

Normally you wouldn't have ever considered going into the forest alone, but with fifty bucks and your pride on the line you couldn't back down. While you didn't have any Pokemon to protect you, you took some solace in the seven inch knife you had attached to your belt, and the sturdy walking stick you carried.

Tasked with going deep into the woods and retrieving a piece of the mossy rock that stood there, you set off at a light jog. You had some idea of the route you would have to take to reach the stone, but you also knew that the forest could become a maze and would be easy to get lost in.

You followed the path for a ways before turning off it and heading into the wilder parts of the forest. The sounds of the wildlife began to die out as you traveled deeper, replaced by an eerie silence. You gripped the staff tighter, in nature silence was a bad thing, it meant that there was a predator, it meant that there was something strong nearby.

Despite the obvious danger you continued to trek deeper and deeper into the forest. It doesn't take you long to find the stone, standing tall amongst the trees. Placing a hand on its smooth weathered down surface, you can almost feel the age of the near monolithic boulder.

Allowing your hand to fall you search around the base for any fragments. On the far side you find a decent sized crack along with several grooves that remind you of teeth marks. Steeling your nerves you slip your hand into the crack and feel for any loose pieces. Reaching along the sides you easily find a fragment that you can pull loose. Your fingers wrap around the stone and you pull with all your might. At first it barely budges, but with a grating sound it finally gives and comes out.

You admire the stone for a moment before placing it in your pocket. As you stand back up a loud buzzing reaches your ears. Nervously you hold the staff in both hands, spaced out so you had a couple feet between your hands and the stick was nearly parallel to the ground. The buzzing increased in volume as the seconds passed until it was deafening, before cutting out and allowing silence to rule once again. You slowly back towards the tree line, watching carefully for any hint of movement.

As you near the trees you notice a flicker of movement above you. Jerking your head upwards you see a flamboyant red form aproaching from the air at an alarming speed. You throw yourself to the side, just barely dodging the crushing hit.Leaping to your feet you spin the staff around so you're holding it like a bat.

"Scizor" rising to its full height of about six feet, the Pokemon was truly intimidating. It's arms ended in wicked pincers with eye marks, rising from its head were three crests, and a small pair of wings stuck out from its back. The carapace shone like dull metal. With what you had already seen, there was no way you could flee, and it would be impossible for you to fight the thing.

But that didn't mean you wouldn't try. Still holding the stick you begin to back away from the insect. It stepped with you maintaining the distance and clicking its pincers menacingly.

"What do you want from me?" You grit your teeth as you ask. "Scizor!" The bug gestures at the large boulder

"Yeah it's a big rock, what do you want?" It gestures at the stone again and then at you before waving a pincer in a "come here" gesture

You can't understand its words, but you think you get the message. One hand slowly releases the stick and finds its way down to your pocket. Visibly tensing as your fingers slip into the pocket, the insect follows your every move. You can feel sweat dripping down your back as your fingers grip the rough sliver of stone.

Slowly you pull out the stone and hold it out to the bug type. In the blink of an eye it had gotten within arms reach and taken the stone. Before you even realized something had happened the Scizor was back in its spot holding the stone. You paled dramatically, the whole time it could have easily killed you. Scizor examined the stone, turning it around and peering closely at it. You again began to back away towards the trees.
11533221221221.title: Story one

115332212212211.content:
"SCIZOR!” you flinch as it shouts, glaring at you again. The crimson insect takes a couple steps towards you. You keep the end of your staff pointed directly at the aggressive bug.

It keeps taking steps towards you, snapping a pincer whenever you try to take a step. It slowly closes the distance between you until you could touch if you reached out “STAY BACK” it hesitates for a second but takes another step. You swing the staff around with all of your might, and with a sharp crack the end strikes across your tormentors face. You try for another swing but before it hits, a red pincer closes around the midsection of your staff.

You try to pull away but its grip is iron, and with a single snip your staff is neatly bisected. You jump back and hurl one of the staff sections at the bug-type, which calmly bats it out of the air. Your now empty hand grips your knife and you lunge forward drawing the blade and swinging it in a sweeping slash across the stomach. Before you even finish the attack a thin metallic arm catches you across the neck in a lariat and throws you onto your back.

As you fall back the Scizor jumps atop you and lightly grabs your neck with a pincer. You relax your whole body immediately, trying to portray submission. Apparently satisfied it releases your neck, only to have you kick your legs under its arms, plant your feet into its underarms and push with everything you’ve got.

You successfully throw the insect and roll to your feet, switching the knife from a backhand grip to a normal one and charge at the downed bug. As it got to its feet you drove the knife hard into its hard carapace. The point of you knife snaps off as it fails to penetrate the steel insect. It retaliates with a heavy strike to your stomach that lifts you off the ground and drives all the air form your lungs. Moving faster than you can react it flits over to your side and slams both pincers down on your back in a double hammer fist.

The force of the blow drives you hard into the ground. You try to ignore the pain as you push yourself up from the ground. A sharp hit to the side knocks you over onto your back, followed by another hit to your stomach. You desperately try to suck in a breath as a clearly pissed off insect stands above you.

All you can do is wheeze helplessly as the crimson bug reaches down and clamps its pincer around your neck. You panic as the pincer starts to squeeze, clawing at the arm and kicking at your enemy. One of your wilder kicks shifts your weight onto your side allowing you lash out with one of your arms at the insects head. In a stroke of luck you manage to jab into its eye, earning a shriek of pain and the freedom to breathe.

You try to crawl away as you gasp for air, but the seething insect gabs the back of your neck and throws you into the boulder, your vision swims as your head collides with the unyielding stone. Your stomach heaves as you pull yourself to your feet, leaning on the boulder.

A pincer roughly clamps around your left arm and yanks hard trying to pull you off the stone. You resist the pull, leaning back towards the boulder. Suddenly your mind goes white and everything is crystal clear, you look over at the Scizor who is glaring back at you, your gaze drops to see your forearm bent at an unnatural angle in the grip of the pincer, broken.

You slowly began to giggle, a high pitched psychotic sound. The sound is cut off as a red pincer collides with side of your head. You fall to your knees, blood dripping from the gash above your eye. Another blow strikes your head, knocking you onto the ground and opening another cut on your head. The crimson bug stands above you pincer raised to strike.

“Hariyama, Arm Thrust” the Scizors’ attention is drawn away from you moments before an incredible force sends it flying into the boulder. You tilt your head slightly and see the three friends that had put you up to this crazy adventure. One hurried to your side and pulled you onto his shoulder, your broken limb hanging limp. You are in such a pain dazed state that you can’t tell who.

A red flash out of the corner of your eye alerts you to the Scizor dashing towards you again. “Counter!” Hariyama places itself firmly in front of you, catches the Steel-bug type, and hits it with a heavy punch to the abdomen that drives it back. Rising to its feet once again Scizor hovers just off the ground and glows pink for a second.

The next attack was too fast for you too even see, one second Hariyama was standing firm, and the next Scizor had pounded it into the ground with a high speed metal claw. “What the fuck?” you hear from one of your friends, “That thing’s way too strong to be wild”

The others send out more Pokémon while one drags you out of harm’s way. He rests you gently against a tree “Wait here” you focus as hard as you can on his face finally identifying him as Garret, a longtime friend. “Arcanine, I need your help” he pops open a pokeball from his belt releasing the large canine “Protect him”

Garret rushes back into the fray releasing another Pokémon to combat the Scizor, which was holding its own against three others. Arcanine places itself between you and the fight, obeying Garrets orders but also denying you a view of the conflict.
The battle continues for a few minutes but even the Scizor can’t continue forever and collapses from exhaustion. One of them throws an ultraball that successfully captures the red Insect. Everyone breathes a sigh of relief as they hear the ping.

Your friends return their Pokémon to their balls, and one retrieves the Scizor. Very carefully the group leads you out of the forest and back into town
115332212212211.title: Scizor stops you

1153322122122111.content:
“GRRAAH!” your fist slams repeated on the bed as the doctors set your broken arm. “It’s a pretty nasty break and it will take some time, but it should heal without any complication. What happened?” “Well, I was in the forest looking for the mossy rock” “Wait, you went into the forest, but you aren’t a trainer. Did you bring one of your friends?” “No” “You went into the forest alone, do you have any idea how stupid that is” You give him a dry look “I think I do” “R-right, please continue”

“I was in the forest looking for the mossy rock, and I found it, but I guess I was in the territory of a Scizor” “A Scizor would explain your injuries, but Scyther can’t evolve without a trainer. Perhaps it was released?” “If It was released someone made a huge mistake, that thing is crazy strong” “strength isn’t the only requirement for a good partner” “I know but seriously, this Scizor was insanely strong, it was able to match several of my friends Pokémon at once, Shawn even has six gym badges”

“Eventually it got worn down, and someone caught it” There’s a tap on your shoulder and a hand places an orange and black pokeball into your hand, “She’s in here” you quickly jerk away from the ball, knocking it onto the ground. The doctor picks up the sphere and holds it out to you. With a shaking hand you take the ball, and stare at it in your hand. “Why are you giving it to me?” “You’re the only one of us without a Pokémon, this isn’t ideal of course, but you need someone to protect you” “She’ll kill me, I don’t have nearly enough badges to train her” “Then just release her, she’ll probably return to her territory”

You go quiet for the rest of the time in the hospital as they fit you with a cast. You are still silent as you walk out the front doors. The sun is setting casting, its fiery glow across the cityscape of Eterna city. You and your friends make your way towards you home only to walk straight past. “Where are you going?” “I’m going to release her” “Now? Shouldn’t you at least wait for tomorrow?” “I wouldn’t feel safe with her in my room”

Despite their protests you make your way back to the edge of the forest. Standing before the trees you steel yourself for what you are about to do. With a shaking hand you press the release catch on the pokeball, and with a flash of light, the very creature that put you in the hospital only a few hours ago was standing before you.

Scizor focuses on you for a moment before getting its bearings. Once it seems to know where it is, you call out “Go home” and drop the ultra-ball. Before the ball even hits the ground you are walking away. “Sciz” you look back to find it has halved the distance between you and is getting closer. “What are you doing?” you ask with no small degree of fear in your voice. Your friends are close but they wouldn’t be able to react in time if Scizor attacked.

“Scizor” you speed up putting some distance between you and the crimson insect. It stops where you dropped the ball and gingerly picks it up, but in an instant it closes the distance between you. It gently grips your uninjured arm and places the orange and black ball in your palm.

“Sciz” it simply stands there, expectantly. You break out in a cold sweat with such a dangerous being standing not two feet from you, “W-what do you want?” “Scizor” it gestures at the ball. “Then take it” you hold it out, but the Scizor refuses to take it. “THEN GO HOME!” you yell, the communication barrier proving extremely frustrating. “Sci” she shakes her head. “Why not” you whine “just go home and leave me alone”

“How about you wrap this up” Garret call from where he’s sitting. “I’m trying!” you yell as he chuckles. “Now, what do you even want” “Scizor” “Screw this” you drop the ball back at your feet, only to have Scizor pick it up and give it to you. “Fine, we’ll play that way” you throw the ball as hard as you can into the forest and take off running back towards town. Scizor immediately takes to the skies and catches the Ultra-ball before you even get back to your friends. Landing in front of you and handing the ball Scizor looks extremely pleased with herself.

“I give up” you simply take the ball and put it in your pocket. “SCIZOR!” the Bug-type calls out to the heavens and you nearly piss yourself as she exuberantly wraps her arms around you. “Scizor sci” she hugs you tightly, putting pressure on your broken arm. “Gahhh!” she immediately releases you and checks you over, making sure she didn’t injure you, before dragging you back into a much more careful hug.

You were still afraid of the red insect, despite her friendliness, and having her that close was not something you were enjoying. You quickly disengage from the happy Pokémon putting a few feet between the two of you. “Return” you put Scizor back in her ball and put that back in your pocket.

“I thought you were going to release her” “So did I” you reply with a beaten tone.
1153322122122111.title: To the hospital

11533221221221111.content:
The walk home was pretty uneventful... you walk and finally reach home but with the cast it was hard to reach into your pocket for the key...

Once you are inside you sit on the couch and sigh out of the thought of all the things that had happened so far... You look at the poke ball they had gave you holding the scizor you finally work up the courage to open it and let her out as she appears she looks around and sees you before she sits down beside you on the side she didn't break "Scizor?" "What is it?" "Scizor scizor?" *Pointing to your arm* "Oh that you don't remember do you you broke it"

*She moves back some* "Scizor?" *Pointing to herself* You just nod to confirm it, soon a couple tears form as she feels terrible at what she had done... "Scizor... Sciz" *Putting her blades together in what looked like a begging position* You look at her and cant seem to stay mad at her in that position. "Alright you can stop I forgive you" *She tries to hug you* "No remember my arm" *She nods and hugs you more carefully*
11533221221221111.title: Head home

115332212212212.content:
The Scizor watches you but makes no move to follow. Once you pass the first tree you turn and sprint away as fast as you can, not caring what direction you’re traveling. You run for as long as you can, until you’re panting with exhaustion and your legs can no longer support your weight. You collapse to your knees and catch your breath. Only when your pulse returns to normal do you begin to look around. After a short look around you are positively sure you don’t know where you are.

“Dammit, I should’ve checked which direction I was running” you get to your feet and try to get your bearings. Unfortunately the trees make it impossible for you to see the sun. Your town is to the west of the forest but you can’t figure out which way that is. Thinking about it for a second you decide to climb a tree to see which direction to go.
You pick a decently sized tree with several low branches and haul yourself up onto the first. Making sure you aren’t disturbing any Pokémon you continue to climb further and further until you can no longer find branches to support your weight. From there you are able to push aside the leaves and see the sky. The sun was nowhere to be seen, dark heavy clouds obscured everything. Dejected, you climb back down.

“Not only is it impossible to see the sun, but it’s going to rain as well, Just my luck” with the incoming storm in mind, you set to work on a shelter. You collect sturdy branches from the ground and lean them together vertically against one of the lower branches. You cover the branches in mud and leaves, creating a barrier. You grab more branches and stack them up along the vertical ones. Before too long you have created an impromptu shelter that should at least protect you from the rain.
Not a moment after you have finished does the rain start and you huddle under your shelter.

“Coming out here was a terrible idea”
115332212212212.title: Scizor lets you go

1153322122122122.content:
Your shelter manages to hold it's own under the rainstorm.

Up until the part where the rain actually started landing on it.
Although you showed potential with your ability to build a makeshift roof in such short time, you were no carpenter. The leaves were dried and cracked resulting in little to no durability and the mud itself was too soft and wet for a sturdy coating. The branches you carefully crafted together were only held steady by a few weak load-bearing twigs that the mud could not keep in place. And the very micro-second after you told yourself coming here was a terrible idea, you remembered watching a weather report earlier today saying that were was gonna be a major rainstorm rivaling El Nino today.

It took no time for that shelter you busted your ass making to collapse right on top of you! You shielded your head from the falling branches, wet mud, and heavy rainfall as you mumbled curses. Perfect time to remind yourself that you shouldve worn a jacket.

It was a long cold wet walk through this raining forest maze. It feels like you've just been walking a straight line, yet the forest never seems to stop. Did you somehow manage to end up in the middle of a whole new forest continent when you stepped out of that cave?!
You quickly regret moving away from that boulder, Scizor or no Scizor. At least the boulder was warm. Your ice cold hands shivered as it missed it's touch. Sure, there was a big scary bug pokemon guarding it, but looking back it really didnt seem all that hostile. All it wanted from you was that piece of the stone you took off back. If it wanted to attack you, it couldve easily done so. Heck, it couldve just snapped off your wrist right then and there as soon as you offered the piece back!

Maybe... just maybe, if you asked it nicely, it couldve at least hinted a way out of the forest in exchange for you never bothering it's special stone again.

Rain poured harder and temperature dropped lower. It was so shivering cold at this point, you pulled your arms inside your shirt and curled them against your bare chest in a desperate attempt to get warm.
"W-w-why d-d-id I agree to that s-s-s-tupid b-bet?" you shivered to yourself, "f-freaking f-fifty bucks'll barely c-cover all the damn cold medicine I'm gonna be needing later!" $50 wasnt jack to you anymore. You'll gladly take the loss and fork over the $50 if it meant you could find your way home again. Back in your nice warm house, in a nice warm shower, cranking the heater to max, and chugging down some hot chocolate. Ah... just thinking those happy thoughts makes you feel a bit warm and cozy.

No, seriously. Youre actually feeling warm. The slight refreshing heat you were feeling was being emitted from the direction of a nearby cave. You'd be thanking Arceus for this blessing of warmth and shelter, but after your first screw up, you decide to be a little cautious before barging into that cave uninvited.

Gripping your walking stick in defense, you peek your head into the brightly lit cavern. The sound of buzzing echoed from the distance. You could see a few little three-headed honeycomb-shaped smiling bugs flying around. Bees. Combees.
You shouldve known it'd be too easy. Inside the cavern lies an active Combee hive. And you know what happens when you rattle a beehive. Pissing off one bug is enough!

However, it's blistering cold and the rain shows no sign of slowing down. If youre desperate for warmth and shelter (and you certainly are), who knows when or if youre gonna find another opportunity like this? Maybe if you just keep a good distance, you wont startle any of them. Or maybe if you only stick around for just a short period of time, they wont mind. Or maybe the Vespiquen of this hive is friendly.
Or maybe all the antidotes in the world wont be able to treat the amount of poison stings you'll receive if you so much as BREATHE their direction!

Either way, youre just getting yourself more wet and chilly wasting time thinking about what to do. Whatever you decide to do, better do it fast.
1153322122122122.title: Forest Slump

11533221221221222.content:
No amount of warmth is worth getting stung to death. You quickly turn and start jogging away from the cave. The rain shows no sign of abating as you attempt to keep yourself warm by jogging. It was an uphill battle as your drenched clothes quickly sucked the warmth from your body.

You keep moving, determined to find another source of warmth. To your surprise, you come across the wreckage of your shelter.

"Dammit I'm just going in circles" your mind travels back to the Scizor. Going back and asking it to lead you out of the forest was looking like a better and better idea with each passing moment.

"If my shelter is here, then the mossy rock should be that way" you begin jogging once again, this time with a firm destination. It takes longer then you remember but it's still not long before you find the clearing from earlier.
Steeling your nerves, you call "Scizor!" When you get no response you call again and again. No matter how many times you call the scissor doesn't appear.

Exhausted, cold, and despondent you slump against the large rock and give up. It's not long before you fall asleep, accepting your fate.

You are woken up by something jabbing at your shoulder. "Scizor" you slowly raise your head to see the crimson insect standing before you, the image of strength.

"Please help me" you plead "can you lead me to the edge of the forest?" The Pokémon remains silent, perhaps thinking about how to help perhaps not, it's face is inscrutable.

After a moment it nods and extends a pincer. Shaking from the cold, you grasp it and are pulled to your feet. The steel bug points in into the tree line and begins walking. You follow eagerly, sticking close to your savior.

"Thank you" the insect hesitates for a moment but keeps moving.

With the guidance of the scissor you soon find yourself at...
11533221221221222.title: Get away from the cave.

115332212212212221.content:
Any other day, you wouldnt dare trust putting your hand in a razor sharp pincer let alone let the owner of said pincer lead you out of a harsh rainy forest! But today you were soaked to toe, freezing to death, and possibly gonna get sick, and this particular Scizor youre blindly following is the closest thing to warm as youre gonna get for now. It had a warm gentle grip on your icy cold hand for something with extremely sharp pincers. If it wanted, it could easily slice your whole hand off with little effort! But this Scizor seemed to be ever so careful not to hurt your wrist.

You were in no state to question whether it was a good or bad idea to trust your life to a wild pokemon. You were too desperate and in need of saving. You didnt care from who. You didnt wanna freeze to death and not be heard from until random campers find your body in the Spring! If it was gonna be a wild dangerous pokemon that saves your butt, so be it! Personally, you'd rather it be an Audino since theyre cuddly, cheerful, practically raised to be nurses (which is why pokemon centers recruit them), know CPR, and give the best hugs! A Scizor is as cuddly as a bag of rusty nails, but beggars cant be choosers!

You edged a little closer to the Scizor, trying to soak in more of it's warmth.
"Sci?!" It's eyes lingered at you for a second, "sci..." but quickly returned it's eyes to the road as if it trying to maintain it's focus.

The walk took a while, but the horrific $50 nightmare came to an end. The endless valley of trees finally ended. Nothing but a clear field and the sight of your town in the distance! You've finally reached the edge of the forest!
Scizor let go of your hand, not realizing you were missing the heat of it. Still, it was over! Praise Arceus!

You sighed in relief, thankful to be out of that stupid maze of a forest! Of course, you didnt forget about the particular one that got you out of that stupid maze of a forest! You werent just thankful. You were eternally grateful! If it hadnt been for that big selfless bug, you mighta never woke up from that rock. And if you did, worst case scenario, you mightve ended up as lunch to that combee hive! MIGHTVE!

You turn to the Scizor and politely bow, attempting to show your gratitude as obvious as possible.
"Thank you," you thanked it, "thank you so much. I really appreciate you helping me out of there. And I'm sorry about the whole ordeal with the rock. I promise I wont touch it again."
"Sci...zor..." it eyes you for a moment, but nods, accepting your gratitude, then turns around to begin it's trek back.

Unfortunately for Scizor, you werent just gonna let a great deed go unrewarded. You owe it. You felt an obligation to repay the favor.

"Scizor wait!"

"Scii?" it turned around, giving you it's attention.
"I cant just you let you go without properly repaying you for what you done," you say.
"Sci. Sci izor." you assumed it said you didnt need to do that. But you werent having that.
"I insist," you tell it, "how'd you like to come over to my place... at least until the rain stops?"

It tilted it's head, curiously.

"It's much better than staying out here," you assure, "not to mention it's warmer, plenty of heating. Also, I'm a good cook. I'll be happy to whip you up dinner."
Scizor squinted it's eyes suspiciously.
"I'm not gonna try to capture you," you say, "I'm not a trainer. And if I was, you think I'd be stupid enough not to bring a pokemon or two with me out in this harsh rainstorm?" You made a good point. Besides, you felt safer being around Scizor anyhow. Not to mention since you werent able to get a piece of that rock, maybe, just MAYBE, you can present the guardian of that rock herself as evidence to get your $50! It's win-win!

"C'mon," you gently take it by the pincer despite how easily it can snap your hand off, "it's the least I can do. And I'd be happy to have my hero...... uhhh...." you carefully inspect Scizor, "...I mean heroINE as my guest of honor this evening! Uh, that is if it's alright with you!"

"Sciiiiiii...." SHE seemed to contemplate that offer. After a brief moment of thinking, she...
115332212212212221.title: A Proper Thank You

1153322122122122211.content:
"Scizor" she nods after a moment of contemplation.

"Great!" you grab one of her pincers and start leading her down the road. "It's not far, just inside the town" at this she hesitates, and it occurs to you that she would probably be nervous entering a human town as a wild pokemon.

"Don't worry as long as you stay with me and don't attack anyone there wont be any problems" apparently reassured, she nods and allows you to lead her the rest of the way. You move at a rather quick pace, wanting to get home and out of the rain.

You reach your home, a small rental property, and usher Scizor inside. once inside you remove your soaking wet shirt and, noticing the water droplets covering Scizors' shell, you grab her a towel. "Here, you can use this to dry off. I'm going to get some dry clothes and then I'll start making dinner" as you leave the living area you call back to Scizor

"Feel free to look around, the couch is kinda old but it's pretty comfy, uhh here," you turn on the TV and hand her the remote, "These buttons change the channels, watch whatever you like" she grasps it gingerly in one pincer and begins to press buttons with the other.

Seeing that she understands the remote you retreat to your room and put on a t-shirt and some sweats. A quick peak into the living room reveals Scizor is seated on the couch and still surfing channels.

"I'm starting dinner, do you like chicken?" finally settling on a channel she nods "Scizor"

"She definitely had a trainer at one point" you think to yourself "Wild pokemon probably wouldn't know what a chicken was much less how it tastes, and she wasn't surprised by the TV"

You put these thoughts aside as you prepare dinner, her past is none of your business, and you doubt she would tell you even if she could. The chicken cooks quickly and you cut hers into smaller pieces to make it easier for her. Since you lack a dining room, you take both plates into the living room and plant yourself on the couch next to her.

"Here, seared chicken," gently she accepts the plate and eats a piece of the chicken.

"Sciz!" she exclaims and eats more

"Is it good?" she nods and continue to eat

"Great, I've never really cooked for anyone before, so I'm glad you like it" pleased with your cooking you start to eat too.

"What are you watching?" between bites she attempts to describe it but you still cant understand her, realizing this she grabs the remote and, after scanning the buttons, presses the one labelled info.

"So you can read too" she nods and gestures for you to read the description. Y0ou comply and find that she's watching one of your favorite show.

"Hey, I love this show, its old but it's a classic. Are you enjoying it?" She nods and settles herself a little deeper into the couch. The two of you continue watching until the end of the episode. After it ends you take her now empty plate and take both to the kitchen, through the window you can see that not only is it still raining, its turned into a downpour.

"Well, its still raining and you're welcome to stay the night, but if you want to head home I wont stop you,"
1153322122122122211.title: ...agrees to come with you!

11533221221221222111.content:
"Sciii...." she seemed hesitant. She may not speak the same language, but she was a very thorough verbal communicator. She took glances at the window, then glances at you in a repeated cycle. You didnt rush her however. She was patient enough to guide you through a rainstorm in the middle of dangerous woods, so you can spare the patience to make up her indecisive mind in a nice warm cozy house.

After what seemed like a particular amount of time that many would consider to be long, Scizor lowered her head and kinda curled into what looked like a very very nervous expression.

"Sci...zor?" she nervously asked. You had a good idea what that question was.
"No, it's no problem at all," you said with a smile, kinda happy she chose to stick around a bit longer, "it's really bad out and I'd love for you to stick around."

"S...sci ZOR s-s-sci..." she rolled her eyes and stuttered a bit as if she was in denial of something, "Z-ZOR sci! S-s-s-sci!" Then it seemed like she was getting defensive for some reason. Unfortunately, that was your limit when it came to verbal communication.
"Uh huh," you just smiled blankly, "well, feel free to make yourself at home. Just try not to make a mess, ok? I just had the carpet rug-doctored."

"Ah what a day." I said as I walked through the park, taking in the bright morning air as I walked on the stony road. It was half past noon last time I asked one of the joggers as they ran by me. But either way it was a great day! I got fired, the sun was shining, the managers' Machoke beat me out as I made a scene, and I protested for a while until I gave up an hour later. Now I'm just walking through the park with a few bruises having a wonderful time! And who am I? Well most people call me Dan, even though it's not my real name though but I don't mind.
I'm 17 and a half almost about to be eighteen in three months too, I have dark brown hair almost turning black from the sun, and dark brown eyes, black shirt and blue jeans. Yup that's it, nothing special really. I looked and noticed a few kids playing with their Pokemon, "Ugh, I should've became a Pokemon trainer..." I sighed a bit and kept walking, I never got a Pokemon, the professor always ran out when I came so I just gave up and lived like a regular human, besides I would never have been a good trainer I get distracted too many times, one reason why I was fired...

Either way I stopped walking and sat on a bench near the forest. Yup I said it there's literally a forest that comes in the path after the park, which is just an easy way for trainers to have fun and then continue their journey. I usually sit here in the late afternoon but since I'm fired I have an early start now. "Hmm?" I turned my head towards the path of the forest, for some reason I seem to be getting weird vibes coming from a particular bush that's conveniently placed next to a tree. It feels as if I'm being watched, it's so strange because I've never had this feeling when I sat in the afternoon. "Eh, it's probably nothing..." I said turning back around and looking up at the sky to watch the clouds a bit before I decided to leave the park.

It seems like a pretty good day, besides getting fired. I mean, what could go wrong?
11533222112211.title: Alright Let's Start!

115332221122112.content:
I sighed a bit as I started to get comfortable on the bench, it seemed like a perfect day for a quick nap before leaving I always take one in the afternoon, it seems more natural for it in the middle of the day too. Oh, I forgot to mention, I live in a small newly found island close by the Kalos region it's close enough to surf over there on a Pokemon actually. After people found out about this island trainers flocked over here like they were birds migrating trying to find new Pokemon and something called a Mega Stone, which I guess makes certain Pokemon stronger or something? This was after some 15-year old beat the champion Diana, I would've wanted to meat this trainer... Oh well.

Everything slowly started to get blurry all of a sudden followed by the light fading away into darkness. This obviously meant that I was slowly dozing off as I sat on the bench also meaning I had to switch positions to laying down. Nobody except me sits here so I doubt anyone would say anything about this. And in no time at all I fell asleep.

-Some Time Later-

"Yeah get 'em!!" A voice said.

"Aw NO WAY!!" Said another.

".... Ngh..." I slowly started to wake up from my nap as I heard some commotion going on. I opened my eyes to see what was going on, I saw a crowd gathering up somewhere near the entrance of the park. I got up and walked over there to see what was going on, when I got there I saw it was just a friend of mine who was battling some other trainer. Strangely his name was Flame, I don't know if that's his real name though but, I went with it.

He was tall, having spiky blonde hair, grass green eyes, and a wild attitude. He's a pretty fun guy to be around, not only that but he's a master trainer he caught every Pokemon there is out there, even most of the Legendaries! Even with all his accomplishments he's never been arrogant or cocky, but he never really thinks things out and always gets into trouble, I sometimes break him out though and out of all that he might even be a little crazy at times. In the end he's a cool guy. The other trainer seemed like one of those aces mainly from another region since I didn't recognize the outfit. He's probably a tourist, the city in the island built a hotel near a beach for all the trainers and tourist's visiting and all.
It seemed like the fight was already over since the Ace was calling his fainted Salamence back into it's Pokeball and people started to leave. "Haha! Another one bites the dust!" Flame said calling his Pokemon back into it's own Pokeball, it must've been a new one since I didn't recognize it.

"I see you're now beating the tourists huh?" I asked Flame as I walked over to him.

"Hm? Oh hey dude hows it goin' and yes I am!" He said with complete confidence.

"Eh fine I guess... I kinda got-" "Fired?" Okay how did he know? "Uh...." "Oh yeah I saw you making a scene as a Machoke was dragging your but out of the building, it was funny so I didn't do anything to stop." At least he tells the truth.....

"Well if ya need a job, I can get you one at that hotel near the beach." Wait he can!? Wow that's close to where I live!

"Wow really? That would be great!" I said as he nodded with a slight fang grin, I never knew how he got those but I didn't want to ask since he might actually show me. "Yup oh by the way you notice anything weird while you were asleep cause I saw a weird figure watching you from afar." He tried emphasizing 'afar' by putting his hand in front of me slowly passing it by to make it seem special.

"Um... No I didn't notice I was asleep.... " I said slightly confused at what he said and did. "Oh well figures, anyway I'd be careful if I was you." He said and turned quickly running off probably to go battle some more trainers.

I didn't know what to do now though but I had two choices:
Either go home, or look for that strange figure Flame was talking about, so.... What next?

Today was one of those glorious days where there wasn't a single Abomasnow for miles around, which left the mountain open for exploration. Even for having lived as long as you have, you haven't set foot on every part of the mountain. What you really wanted to find was a mysterious being dubbed 'The Siren of the Mountain.' It was only given this name because you, and countless others, have heard it, night after night, singing its haunting melody.Oddly enough, the song hasn't worked on humans, but you've seen several formidable Pokemon ditch a good meal because they heard its song. Because of this reasoning, you are absolutely positive the being is some kind of Pokemon.

After spending most of the day collecting wood for a fire, making sure your food storage was good enough to last you the month, all of the things you'd normally do, you sat in your home in wait. Dressed in your warmest clothes, you were going to make your search for this Pokemon, starting at sundown, when the Pokemon began singing. You only had a small window of time to find it, as it stopped whenever it captured something. Once night fell, and you heard its eerie song, you left home and trekked as quickly as you could through the cold, deep snow and went up the mountain towards this mystery Pokemon.

11533222222222221221.content:
It wasnt bad being an intern for a pokemon research center that studies the supernatural. Sure, you didnt believe in it, but it didnt matter to you. It was easy experience and it beats studying several years spending hundreds of thousands of dollars in some big wig university when you can actually get some experience and hands-on training for free! Granted the researchers were pretty odd and had very interesting personalities, but nothing unbearable.

Professor Imariel was quite possibly the most interesting pokemon prof you had the privilege of working for. The slightly heavy-set incredibly curly bearded chap had a professional demeanor and always kept an even temper regardless of any stressing situation despite his odd interest in imaginary creatures seemed anything but professional.
He talked a lot about things called 'Ultra Beasts'. Pokemon from a whole other dimension called 'Ultra Space'. He'd go on and onin deep detail about what he knew about them (or what he THOUGHT he knew) despite no other pokemon professor that you know of even believes in any of that stuff. Imariel, on the other hand, devoted an entire lab to study the fictional Ultra Beasts.

You'd check him off as a little crazy, but he's provided free lodging AND a trade that'll help when you look for a REAL job as a pokemon researcher, so you keep your mouth shut and do as youre told. Besides, your internship was pretty easy to follow through. Just jot down notes, pay attention to detail, humor him when he goes on a UB-rant, sight-see, and assist with clean up. You got no incentive to complain.

During the final week of your internship, Imariel claims he has just discovered the location of one of these so-called Ultra Beasts and demands you come with him to this uncharted tribal island in the middle of nowhere to witness it in all it's majesty. Being stupid and loving to travel, you agree.

“According to what I've researched, the natives of Hime-Hime Island perform a special ceremony paying tribute to what they believe is their goddess of the moon,” he explained to his staff during the cruise ride to the island, “legend has it this moon goddess appears before them once every 50 years on this very day. From my interview with their tribal chief, her physical description that he gave me bears a rather uncanny resemblance to what may very be UB-04. Also known as 'Celesteela'.”
Professor Imariel turns his head to you, “[Anthony], I'm gonna require you to come with me to meet the chief. Your attendance is absolutely detrimental to my project.” Detrimental, he says! “Are you ready to make history?”
“I am, Professor Imariel!” you state with more pride than you really had.

Hime-Hime Island didnt seem like the stereotypical 'tribal' island you assumed it be. Instead of a 'tropical' setting, it was more like a 'far eastern oriental' theme. You know, shrines, pagodas,cherry blossom trees, huge drums, lanterns, that sort of thing. And judging from the fireworks, lit candles and the music, they were having a festival. No doubt to pay tribute to the 'moon goddess'.

Imariel marched toward the big fancy looking shrine with you following and met with who assumed was the island chief. The professor bowed and the chief bowed back before speaking to him in an unfamiliar language. Imariel replied back in the same language as the island's soldiers surrounded you.

“It's fine. They were already aware we were coming,” he explained to you, “they've arranged special front row seats to witness the grand return of the moon goddess in all her glory.”
“Alright,” you say, pretending to sound more excited than you really are, “I cant wait to see the great Celesteela herself.”
Imariel translated what you said to the chief. He smiled and said something as he pointed to you.
“[Anthony], present yourself to the chief,” he translated.
You nodded and stepped up to the old balding heavy-set gentlemen in oriental dress. The chief observed you carefully, feeling your face and cheekbones, observing your eyes, and inspecting your mouth. After an uncomfortable brief moment, he nods his head and calls his soldiers over.

...Who quickly grab your arms and restrain you. This didnt seem like a friendly gesture so you got concerned.
“P-Professor Imariel, what are they doing?” you asked him who looked completely unchanged by this action.
“Theyre going to offer you as tribute,” he calmly replied. Certainly not a friendly gesture.
“What?! Tribute?!”
“That was part of the deal I made with the chief,” he nonchalantly explained, “in exchange for helping me with my research, I would provided him with a worthy tribute to their goddess. I couldnt think of one more worthy than yourself.”
“W-wha, w-w-wait!!!” you struggled, “what kind of tribute are they looking for?!”
Imariel asks the chief. The chief goes on a long speech, ushering his arms, raising them up to the sky then downward, clenching his fists and opening them as he speaks with such passion in his voice.
“Sacrifice,” Imariel answers.

“SACRIFICE?!!” you heard him correctly, “TH-THAT'S RIDICULOUS! I DIDNT AGREE TO THIS!”
“Oh, I'm afraid you did [Anthony],” Imariel corrects you, “the waiver you signed clearly stated there may be controversial situations you'd be involved in within this line of work that would be hazardous to your health.” He considered human sacrifice as a 'controversial situation'?!

Despite your clear frustration, the islanders were not patient for it. You were immediately dragged off as you screamed, “YOU WONT GET AWAY WITH THIS! MY FAMILY'LL SUE!!”
“They cant sue! That's in the waiver, too!” he shouted back.

You fought desperately to break free of your captors, but they were strong and there were many of them. Still, you struggled and squirmed all the way to the summit of a mountain where the majority of the villagers were gathering around. After nearly tiring yourself out resisting in vain, your captors tie you to a pole on the summit. Far down below, you could see the damn professor and a few of his assistants alongside the island chief and several villagers looking up at you. You could hear active music that had good rhythm and beat, but in your situation, they may as well have been singing “NA NA NA NA HEY HEY HEY GOODBYE!!”

“Get the camera ready, Ali,” Imariel ordered one of his assists, “we are about to witness an extraordinary phenomenon that may not ever occur again in our lifetimes!”

No sooner after he said that, thunder and lightning struck! The clouds began to shift and spin! Then the earth rumbled and shook! You were hit by an incredibly bright blinding flash and your ears buzzed like you were hit by a flashbang!

Then you heard it.

“HUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU!”

A loud high-pitch howl that echoed all directions.

“WHAT WAS THAT?! WHAT THE HELL WAS THAT?!!” you screamed with terror.

The chief shouted to his people with enthusiasm in his voice.
“Behold! Our great beloved goddess in all her glory graces our presence!” Imariel translated with the same enthusiasm.

“HUUUUUUUUUUU!!!” you heard the high-pitch howl again.

“Let me down! Let me down! Let down! LET ME DOWN!!!” you panicked but no one paid attention to your cries. They were staring in awe at the colossal figure that appeared in the distance.
A giant green-haired feminine figure with an outrageously long skinny accordion-like neck with a huge spike sticking out of the top of it's head and two blade-like protrusions poking out of the sides of it. Though you couldnt see the eyes behind it's hair (unless those green orbs on it's forehead ARE the eyes), you can feel then gazing your direction.

It's wide abdomen looked like it a green kimono over a large wide rocket which hovered in the air. Your jaw dropped when you saw the detached arms that look like two big bamboo canons with fingers! It wasnt a pokemon, it wasnt even a goddess, it was a living breathing doomsday weapon!

“HUUUUUUUUU!!!” it called out as it approached.
Riddled with fear, you screamed off the top of your lungs but no one cared about your cries except for Imariel.
“Dont scream too much! She's very easy to startle!”

Celesteela continued her approach and you were running out of time before your fate was left in her mercy. If you were gonna act, you need to act fast!
11533222222222221221.title: Tribute to the Goddess

115332222222222222213.content:
Ah, the nice soothing, relaxing, and at the same time energizing atmosphere that can only come from the peak of Autumn. If anyone ever asked you what was your favorite season, it'd take you no more than a second to response in big bold letters FALL! Because it was the absolutely perfect time of the year to go jogging!
The blistering hot summer weather's long gone, but the unbearable freezing your pokeballs off winter weather is still a ways away. The lightly cool wind blew through your skin and hair as you jogged down the beaten field. The sun is out, but it's not blindingly bright so you dont need glasses. It's pretty cloudly, but with a near 0% chance of rain according to the weatherman who is never wrong (and not just because the law arrests inaccurate weather forecasters in this region!).


And best of all, no wild pokemon prowling around. The tall grass they like to use for ambushes have already dried up and withered away. Without their best factor for the element of surprise, the vast majority tend to leave this route and migrate to more grassier territory or near the mountains where there are plenty of big rocks and caves for hiding.

Not to mention, without the wild pokemon, there are no loud annoying pokemon trainers wandering about trying to hunt them down or challenging eachother to pokemon battles, which means jogs down the Route are peaceful and quiet. Plenty of time and opportunity to clear your head of any bad chi while you work your cardio.

At least until today that is. Turns out not ALL the wild pokemon were drawn away from the Route during the Fall season. In fact, some may have been drawn toward it. One in particular you've had the pleasure of encountering. And unfortunately for you, it was a very slimy one.

*Poink!*

Your peaceful relaxing jog came to a pause because you stepped in something you really shouldnt have. It was wet, squishy, gooey, and slimy. Ew.
“Aw… great,” you groaned in disgust. Your immediately assumption was that you stepped in some fresh poke-droppings.
But you looked down and notice that it wasnt droppings. It was slime. Clear, greenish, sticky, wet slime! And it stuck to your shoe pretty well! Dang, and they were brand new, too. Still cringing, you grind your shoe against the dirt to scrape off some that sticky gooey stuff.
“Hope it's not poisonous,” you say to yourself.

As you finished scraping off what you could, you noticed there were more puddles of slime down the path you were taking. Bad feeling.
You wondered where they came from, but you had a pretty good guess. Mustve been left behind by a really slimy pokemon. A grimer, maybe? Best not tread that way then! The last thing you want is to get attacked by a poison type!
Unforunately, while you were busy observing the slime tracks, you failed to notice said slimer had already crept up at you from right behind! By the time you noticed something was behind you, you spotted the shadow of a rather long neck with long tentacle-like protrusions sticking out the head portion descend on you!

“Gooo?”

It's slightly high pitched voice called from above. You froze up, taking slow quiet breaths, and gathered your thoughts.

“Goo….draaaaa...” it called again.

Slowly you turned, very slowly, hoping not to spook whatever just caught you off guard! After a long uncomfortable minute, you finished turning and had to tilt your head at the rather tall lavender-colored pudgy creature staring down at you with it's big green eyes beaming with interest! This bipedal creature stood over 6 feet tall with long tentacle-like antennae, short stubby horns in front of them, a long purple ventral portion reaching from the bottom down half of it's face all the way down to the very end of it's thick curly tail and big green spots on the sides of it's cheeks and the sides of it's tail! Oh, and it was dripping slime. Very slimy. You definitely didnt wanna touch it.

“Draaa! Goo dra!”

A GOODRA?!! What the heck is a Goodra doing all the way here in this Route?! They aint native around here! Heck, their nearest habitat that you know of aint for miles! And that place hasnt rained since Spring! But there was no trainer in sight, so it was most certainly wild. Wild and unpredictable. And possibly hungry. And maybe a little disgruntled what with being a long way from home! And possibly hungry.

“Goooooooo...” it's cute slimy face leaned in toward you as if eyeing with sheer curiosity. You could see the sweat dripping down your forehead through the reflection in it's eyes!

Whatever the reason it's here, it's high-leveled dragon-type. Being a dragon-type was bad enough, cuz theyre not meant to be taken likely by beginners! But this dragon-type was Level 50 at the LEAST cuz that was the bare minimum for it's previous form, Sliggo to evolve! Sadly, that's about all you knew about Goodras.

“Draaa! Goodra!” the Goodra continued to observe you. You had no clue how long it was gonna observe you before it finally reacted! And you had no clue how to properly deal with a wild goodra. Do you ignore it and show no fear like with a Mightyena? Look it right in the eyes and stretch your body out to look taller and more intimidating like with an Ursaring? Play dead like with a Kangaskhan? Compliment it on it's muscular physique like with a Machoke?

There were so many options to choose from and such little time to choose from them!
As you thought, the Goodra continued staring at you with curiosity. It didnt seem very threatening. Maybe it means you no harm. In fact, it's look of beamed interest in you was kinda cute. The Goodra itself looked adorably cute. The huggable kind of cute… if it wasnt so dang slimy!
Then again, for all you know, one false move and it could swallow you whole in a single gulp! So you had to think carefully. Lucky for you, the Goodra was not impatient. You had plenty of time to think your next move.

So you think… until finally, you decide to...

141311.title: Years later

141331.content:
Sakuma & Kiyota  


You are Kiyota the Braixen, and you’re watching your trainer walk out his apartment door. The second he leaves, you jump to work.

It is his birthday today. It doesn’t seem he remembered, being so busy and all, but you definitely did! You’ve been planning all month to have the perfect surprise ready for him -- his favorite lumiose galettes, homemade with love! Of course, being a Pokémon, you’ve never cooked anything before… but it couldn’t be that hard!

You and your trainer Sakuma used to spend many a lazy afternoon together, wandering the beautiful city and meeting all sorts of interesting people. But nowadays, he spends all of his time studying at the Lumiose City Academy, leaving you to lounge around in his apartment, doing housework and trying to kill time. You always wish you could just go on adventures together like you used to… but Sakuma is just so busy nowadays, you can’t bring yourself to impose on him. You just do what you can to make him happy, whenever he’s around.

You pulled open your personal chest, retrieving all the supplies you had been gathering over the months in preparation for today. With this, you noticed your first problem -- all the ingredients, the flour, the apricorns, the berries, were soggy and moist. You realize you probably should’ve picked a better container to keep these in. “Well, it’ll probably be fine…” you think to yourself, kneading the squishy, foul-smelling berries in your paw. “He probably won’t even notice!” Still, panic was already starting to creep in.

The dough crumbled when you tried to roll it out, the berries melted in your hands, the recipe insisted on ingredients you had never even heard of, and time was quickly running out until your trainer returned home. You tried to calm your nerves by reminiscing on old days while you worked.

Sakuma never had any interest in becoming a serious Pokémon trainer. He always wanted to become an engineer, and improve society as a whole instead of seeking personal glory. Still, when he left his hometown to study in Lumiose city, his mother insisted he get a starter Pokémon to keep him safe. Back when he was alone in Lumiose, you were his only friend, and the two of you spent all day together, going on adventures. But now, he has real friends. Human friends. And you? You were just… his Pokémon.

You guess you should be thankful he at least never keeps you in a Pokéball.

You realize with a start that you’ve left the oven running this entire time.

The sorry excuses for galettes looked mangled and burnt, with crust that was both soggy and overbrowned, and the berries a sloppy mess. You whimpered a little as you looked down on the birthday treat you had been so looking forward to creating. How could you have failed so spectacularly? Any human could have done this easily. Maybe that’s why Sakuma doesn’t hang out with you much anymore. Maybe you don’t deserve him in the first place. You’ll never be as smart, or funny, or charismatic as all Sakuma’s real friends are. You’ll always just be his dumb, useless Pokémon.

Your thoughts are interrupted when you hear your trainer opening the doorway, and you realize there are tears in your eyes. “Kiyota, I’m back!” he called, and you cringed. You felt the panic in your chest, and wanted more than anything to hide all the evidence of your little venture, but you were frozen in place. You could only stand there, covered in flour, clutching the foul-smelling mixture in your paws as he walked in. “Uh… whoa. What have you been up to?”

"I-I'm sorry..." you say, feeling the tears flow more freely now. "I was set up to make a nice surprise for you, but... I-I just can't do anything right..."

“Whoa, Kiyota...” Sakuma frowned, tossing his bag aside and kneeling down to face you. He took you up in his arms, and you cried weakly into his shoulder as he comforts you, wetting his jacket with tears. You had been trying to keep these emotions bottled up for months, but now, they were all pouring out. “What's this all about?”

"Y-you and your friends are so good at so many things! Human things! Cooking, computers, engineering..." you say, feeling the tears flow more freely now. "I r-really want to be like your friends, but I just can't figure any of it out! I'm j-just a Pokémon..."

“Come on, Kiyota. You know better than that,” Sakuma said, obviously a little taken aback that you felt that way. “You’re not ‘just a Pokémon”. You’re my best friend, and you can do anything you set your mind to. There’s plenty of things you’re better than me at, after all.”

You blink. "Y-you really think so?"

“Of course. Different people are good at different things. Nothing wrong with that,” Sakuma smiled, and you smiled back a little. He gazed over at the burnt mess that was lying on the floor. “Now what were you trying to make, here? Some galettes?”

"Yeah..." you nod, a bit ashamed.

“Tell you what. Why don’t we cook something up together? I can give you a few pointers,” Sakuma offered, and smiled so warmly you couldn’t help but smile back. “Then we can have a nice dinner together. After all, if you wanted to hang out all this time, you could’ve just asked.”

You dry your face with your paw, realizing how silly you had been. Of course Sakuma cared for you. You WERE one of his real friends, and you have been for years. Just because you’re a Pokémon… that doesn’t change anything. "That sounds… perfect," you reply with a grin.
141331.title: Sakuma & Kiyota

1413321.content:
While sucking gently on the dick in your mouth, you think back on the events that got you into this situation, as people with dicks in their mouths are apt to do.

Being a Pokémon trainer isn’t always as exciting as it seems. As with all ‘adventurous’ careers, it’s mostly down time. Routes are a lot longer than some people believe, most taking days to transverse; thus, your trainer, Kataoka, spends most of his time simply walking from town to town in complete silence, enjoying the peace and quiet of nature. Despite the fact that your legs always felt sore, you did enjoy sharing your trainer’s nomadic life style. The peace and
quiet of the natural trails gave you a lot of time to just… think. And you’ve been doing a lot of thinking recently.

Your trainer and you were always moving from place to place, wandering the wilderness on your own, not really able to make many permanent friends along the way. For years, you’ve been his only real companion… and thus, you’ve volunteered to take care of his ‘needs’, whenever the necessity arises, and he does the same for you whenever you’re in estrus. That’s all it was -- routine maintenance. Surely neither of you were enjoying it or anything! You definitely weren’t a couple. Admittedly, these flings have slowly been becoming more and more frequent and intimate… but surely, your trainer must just be fantasizing about one of the human girls he knows.

After all, a human like him could never fall in love with a simple Pokémon like you…

… right?

You looked up at Kataoka fondly as you cradled his shaft with your tongue. He hasn’t been able to shave yet on this expedition, giving him a prominent five o’clock shadow, which you always loved. He also donned a thick brown flight jacket to protect him from the chilly northern winds, which gave him a bit of an outdoorsy look. Something about him just seemed so perfect to you. “Kurisu, seriously… you don’t have to...” He said, looking a little guilty. Just a few minutes earlier, the two of you had been sitting around the campfire, when you noticed a long-brewing tension in your companion that you were more than happy to take care of.

“Shh…” You whisper, crudely. “Let me take care of you…” You struggled with the english language, but you knew how to say a few basic phrases, having been patiently taught by your trainer. Still, you preferred to stay silent most of the time, but Kataoka always loved to hear your voice during sex, so you whisper sweet nothings into his ears whenever you need to calm him down. Seeing how willing your are, Kataoka hesitantly leans back and relaxes, closing his eyes as you gently take his entire shaft in your mouth, letting it press against the back of your throat. Besides the sound of the campfire, the two of you were dead silent, both trying to pretend not to enjoy this; however, Kataoka can’t help but let out little moans as you slide your tongue back and forth against his shaft, which you have to admit excites you a little.

You move your lips back and forth along his shaft painfully slowly, sending your tongue over every inch of your trainer’s manhood as you gently suck him off by the campfire. He was always worried that another trainer might stumble upon the campsite, but in the vast expanse of the wilderness, that was next to impossible. It was just you and him, now… and the two of you had as long as you needed. Eventually, you sense that the man’s about to reach his climax, and plunge his shaft as deep into your maw as it would fit. It didn’t take long for your trainer to blow his load down your throat, and you delighted as you felt the man tense up, completely failing to stifle one last moan as he thrusted forward. You listened to his exhausted pants as you made sure to swallow every last drop, before finally opening your mouth, letting his manhood slip free from your lips. “There…” You whisper, softly. “Isn’t that all better?”

He nodded curtly, still not daring to open his eyes. As you sit there, slowly licking his shaft clean, you wonder what he must be thinking about. He might’ve been fantasizing about that lady that runs the Blackthorn gym… or perhaps he was picturing the lady that hosts that news channel he's always watching. Or, maybe… he was thinking about you.

You quickly wipe that thought from your mind. That was silly. You were just a simple, ugly Pokémon. Why would he ever be fantasizing about somebody like you? … at least, that’s what you tell yourself. Either way, you fall asleep that night wrapped in his arms, as the two of you keep each other comfy and warm throughout the dark, cold night...
1413321.title: Kurisu & Kataoka (18+)

14133211.content:
The next day, you were back out on the road again, following contentedly by your trainer’s side. You’d get goosebumps sometimes when you look up at him, still feeling the buzz from last night. Every once in awhile, he’d check his Pokétch, keeping track of your progress to the next town. “How long have we been walking?” You ask, struggling to pronounce certain words.

“Eighteen kilometers,” he replies simply. Due to the fact that he was always travelling, Kataoka always wanted to make consistent progress every day; the two of you already take a break for lunch after 20km, and set up camp for the day at 40. Of course, that wouldn’t be strictly necessary today; the two of you are going to arrive in Goldenrod city in just a few hours! You had been bustling with excitement for the entire journey. Goldenrod was your favorite city in Johto! There were all kinds of new sights you’re hoping to see, and old friends you’re hoping to catch up with. Unfortunately, he was only willing to stick around here for a weekend -- Kataoka had business in Saffron City -- but you had already made up your mind to savor every second as much as you can.

Even though you’re only a few minutes away from town, the two of you decide to sit down and have a bit to eat anyway. The restaurants in human cities are alright, but expensive, and to be honest, you enjoyed the soups Kataoka cooks for you even more. He’s learned how to make the perfect stew over the years just to put a smile on your face -- which, you suppose, is what it means for something to be “made with love”. You help him collect and arrange some kindling in a fire, before you light it up by breathing a single, small flame. You watch with fascination as he brews the soup in a big pot balanced over the fire, the delicious smell drifting through the forest. “Smells delicious,” you say, sniffing at the air.

He chuckles, looking down on you, and you blush a bit. Being a human, he of course can’t find you attractive… but he does think you’re cute, and that’s close enough. “You say that about everything I cook,” he said, idly stirring the pot with a wooden spoon.

“It’s always true,” you reply. You always had a bit of trouble pronouncing the letter ‘r’. In fact, with the way your snout is shaped, it’s downright impossible. You always found it embarrassing, but Kataoka seemed to find it adorable. He chuckles a little, to your annoyance. Eventually, breakfast is ready, and you chow down while Kataoka fiddles with his journal. “So… you were up last night,” you decide to mention.

He looks at you blankly for a while. “I… couldn’t sleep,” he admitted, and you frowned. Did you do something wrong last night? Did you make him uncomfortable? Just as you were about to ask, he leans forward, offering you his journal. “But I did take the time to draw this.”

You look down at the journal in front of you. One page was covered in all sorts of sketches, most notably a drawing of a grand, majestic bird Pokemon you’ve never seen before, seemingly in flight. The art style was very basic and simplistic, but still impressive. “Whoa. What is that?”

“Oh, just a staraptor,” he replied. “I spotted one roosting while we were walking yesterday.”

You flipped the pages a few times with your snout, looking through Kataoka’s sketches of various wild Pokemon. “Wow, these are really good,” you said, shocked by the quality of a few sketches. “Why didn’t you tell me about these?”

“They’re nothing special,” he shrugged, dismissively. “I mean, anybody could draw those.” You were about to argue, until you realized; any human could draw these. With your paws, even if you practiced for your entire life, you would never be able to draw like this. Your ears droop as you consider your natural inferiority. There are so many things that come naturally to humans that you would never be able to master. In that moment, though, you wonder… what if you were a human? You beamed at the thought. If you were a human, you could have a little home in Goldenrod city, and spend all day painting and cooking, and Kataoka and you could get married...

“Well, either way, you need to draw more,” you hurriedly say, realizing you’d gotten lost in thought.

“Uh… alright,” he nodded. “Anything you have in mind?”

You were about to turn him down, but... “Hm. Maybe… you could, uh… draw me? But as, y’know…” you ask, tentatively, trying not to sound weird. “... a human?”

He raised a brow, giving you a weird look, seeming amused. “As a human?”

“Yeah, you know, just, what you think I would look like if I was… ahem…” You try to explain yourself, but eventually, you’re so embarrassed you start stuttering. “Actually, no. Never mind. That’s a stupid idea.”

He gave you a bemused look for a second, before smiling. “I think that’s a great idea,” he said, and your ears perk up as he rubs your head, cheerfully. You always love it when he pets you. “I’ll get right on it… right after we make it to town.” You look down, and realized you had devoured the soup while you were distracted by your conversation.

“... oh, right,” you chuckled. “Alright, lead the way!” The two of you promptly packed up your things and walked down the dirt path for another half hour, until the bright lights of the beautiful city became visible over the trees. “Wow...” You were practically jumping with excitement by the time you walked through the gates. You had grown used to living in the wilderness, and thus, you were always awed by the sheer scale and beauty of human cities. People and Pokemon were wandering down the streets in unbelievable numbers, and you have to stick close to your trainer’s side to avoid getting lost. You happily greeted the other Pokemon you spot as you walk by. You’d never seen some of these species before!

Eventually you reach a neighborhood atop a hill on the southwest side, giving you an unbelievable view of the vast ocean. This is where Kataoka old friend lived; Isuzu, a friendly Pokemon breeder, who lives in a beautiful, quaint little hut by the sea. Excitement rises in your chest as Kataoka knocks on the door. Eventually, Isuzu pulled it open and greeted you. She looked a little more bookish than you remember, with wide-framed glasses and a dorky green turtleneck sweater hiding her curvy frame. “Katoaka!” She greeted your trainer cheerfully, holding her arms out for a hug. “Oh, how long has it been?”

“Too long,” he smiled, and you felt a little jealous as he wrapped her in a familial hug. “Nice to see ya.”

“Oh! Mm! You need a bath,” Isuzu giggles, pulling away.

“Oh, yeah, sorry. I’ve been walkin’ Route 35 all week,” Kataoka chuckled, a little embarrassed, rubbing the back of his head. “Here, let me get unpacked.” He walks deeper into the house, towards the guest bedroom.

“After all these years, you’re still quite the outdoorsman, huh?” She calls after him. Once he disappeared out of sight, Isuzu finally turns to you, inviting you inside. “And how have you been doin’, little lady?” She kneels down, petting you on the back of your neck while you wag your tail cheerfully. “Been getting up to trouble?”

“You betcha!” You nod, jokingly.

“Oh! I see your english lessons are going well,” she said, seeming a little surprised and impressed to see you speaking human. The last time you and Isuzu talked, you could barely say your own name. “If only Akako caught on so quickly…”

Your ears perked up at the very mention of that name. Akako is Kataoka’s prized ninetails, and undoubtedly your best friend in Goldenrod city. The two of you have known each other since you were just a houndour, but unfortunately, you haven’t been able to keep in touch recently. “Akako?” You beam. “Is Akako here?”

Isuzu giggles at your excitement. “She’s in the backyard, by the beach,” she smiled. “You two can go explore the city if you want. Me and Kataoka have to catch up.” You nodded, before sprinting off without even bothering to reply.

You eagerly run around the side of the house. You had been planning to chill out in Isuzu’s house for a while, but you didn’t want to miss out on a single moment with Akako. She could show you all the new buildings they’ve been building around Goldenrod! Then maybe the two of you could go for a swim… or maybe dig through the dumpsters of that one pizza place… or… or…

Your thoughts are interrupted when you finally reach the back yard, and see the unmistakable silhouette of the ninetails before you...
